Constructor & Destructor Documentation

QuantMethodSamplerReport::QuantMethodSamplerReport ( int  reportModulus,
const std::string &  prefix,
int  precision,
bool  doRawIntensities,
bool  doSummaries,
bool  doMadResiduals 
) [inline]

Constructor.

Parameters:
reportModulus - Sampling rate for how often a report is generated. For example 9 means that 1 out of every 10 probeset groups will be reported on.
prefix - Prefix name for report files, usually something like experimentDir/rma
precision - How many digits to print after the decimal place.
doRawIntensities - Print a sampling report for raw probe intensities.
doSummaries - Print a sampling for general summaries.
doMadResiduals - Print a report for median absolute residuals.

bool QuantMethodSamplerReport::finish ( QuantMethod &  qMethod  )  [inline, virtual]

No more probesets will be processed, this is a chance to finish outputting results and clean up.

Parameters:
qMethod - Quantification method that was used.
Returns:
true if success, false otherwise.

Implements QuantMethodReport.

bool QuantMethodSamplerReport::prepare ( QuantMethod &  qMethod,
const IntensityMart &  iMart 
) [inline, virtual]

Get set up for a run of reporting probesets.

Often used to open file streams and print headers to files etc.

Parameters:
qMethod - Quantification method to be used.
layout - Where the probesets, probes, etc are on the chip.
Returns:
true if success, false otherwise.

Implements QuantMethodReport.

const IntensityMart &  iMart,
std::vector< ChipStream * > &  iTrans,
PmAdjuster &  pmAdjust 
) [inline, virtual]

After every probeset computation this function is called an is an opportunity to query the quantification method for results, residuals, etc.

Parameters:
psGroup - List of probesets from which probes were used.
qMethod - Quantification method with compute method called.
layout - Where the probesets, probes, etc are on the chip.
Returns:
true if success, false otherwise.
